downloader.tab_widget.title: Downloader Mode
downloader.tab_widget.content: Switch between creating a new download job or resuming a previous one.

downloader.new_job.available_symbols.title: Available Instruments
downloader.new_job.available_symbols.content: Lists all instruments that can be downloaded. Double-click to add an instrument to the download queue.

downloader.new_job.selected_symbols.title: Selected Instruments (Download Queue)
downloader.new_job.selected_symbols.content: All instruments in this list will be downloaded when the job starts. Double-click to remove an instrument.

downloader.new_job.symbol_search.title: Symbol Search
downloader.new_job.symbol_search.content: Filter the list of available instruments by their symbol (e.g., 'RELIANCE').

downloader.new_job.sector_filter.title: Sector Filter
downloader.new_job.sector_filter.content: Filter the list of available instruments by their industry sector.

downloader.new_job.start_date.title: Start Date
downloader.new_job.start_date.content: The beginning of the date range for which to download historical data.

downloader.new_job.end_date.title: End Date
downloader.new_job.end_date.content: The end of the date range for which to download historical data.

downloader.new_job.interval.title: Interval
downloader.new_job.interval.content: The time interval for each data candle (e.g., 'minute', 'day').

downloader.new_job.output_dir_input.title: Output Directory
downloader.new_job.output_dir_input.content: The folder where the downloaded data files will be saved.

downloader.new_job.output_dir_button.title: Browse for Directory
downloader.new_job.output_dir_button.content: Open a file dialog to select the output directory.

downloader.resume_job.manifest_path_inpu.title: Manifest File Path
downloader.resume_job.manifest_path_inpu.content: Path to a `manifest.json` file from a previously stopped download job.

downloader.resume_job.manifest_path_butt.title: Browse for Manifest
downloader.resume_job.manifest_path_butt.content: Open a file dialog to select a `manifest.json` file.

downloader.progress_bar.title: Download Progress
downloader.progress_bar.content: Shows the overall progress of the current download job.

downloader.log_view.title: Log Output
downloader.log_view.content: Displays real-time log messages from the downloader.

downloader.start_button.title: Start Download
downloader.start_button.content: Begins the download process based on the settings in the currently active tab (New Job or Resume Job).

data_source.time_interval.title: Time Interval
data_source.time_interval.content: Filters the available downloaded data by its time interval. This must match the data you intend to use for training.

data_source.instrument_selection.search.title: Symbol Search
data_source.instrument_selection.search.content: Filter the list of available instruments by typing a part of the symbol name (e.g., 'RELIANCE').

data_source.instrument_selection.sector_.title: Sector Filter
data_source.instrument_selection.sector_.content: Filter the list of available instruments by their industry sector.

data_source.instrument_selection.index_f.title: Index Filter
data_source.instrument_selection.index_f.content: Filter the list of available instruments by the index they belong to (e.g., 'Nifty 50').

data_source.instrument_selection.availab.title: Available Instruments
data_source.instrument_selection.availab.content: This list shows all instruments that match the current filter criteria. Double-click an instrument to add it to the selected list.

data_source.instrument_selection.selecte.title: Selected Instruments
data_source.instrument_selection.selecte.content: This list contains all the instruments that will be included in the dataset for training. Double-click an instrument to remove it.

data_source.instrument_selection.add_but.title: Add to Selection
data_source.instrument_selection.add_but.content: Add the highlighted instruments from the 'Available' list to the 'Selected' list.

data_source.instrument_selection.remove_.title: Remove from Selection
data_source.instrument_selection.remove_.content: Remove the highlighted instruments from the 'Selected' list.

data_source.instrument_selection.add_all.title: Add All
data_source.instrument_selection.add_all.content: Add all currently visible instruments from the 'Available' list to the 'Selected' list.

data_source.instrument_selection.remove_.title: Remove All
data_source.instrument_selection.remove_.content: Remove all instruments from the 'Selected' list.

data_source.master_date_range.start_date.title: Master Start Date
data_source.master_date_range.start_date.content: The absolute earliest date from which to consider data for this experiment. The available range is determined by the common date range of all selected instruments.

data_source.master_date_range.end_date.title: Master End Date
data_source.master_date_range.end_date.content: The absolute latest date to which to consider data for this experiment.

data_source.validation_method.split_meth.title: Validation Method
data_source.validation_method.split_meth.content: Determines how the master data range is split into training and validation sets.

options.Date Range: Manually define specific start and end dates for both training and validation sets. Gives you full control.
options.Percentage Split: Automatically splits the data. The most recent data is reserved for validation based on the percentage you set.
options.Time-Series K-Fold: Performs cross-validation by creating multiple 'folds' of training/validation splits over time. More robust, but computationally expensive.

data_source.validation_method.date_range.title: Training Start Date
data_source.validation_method.date_range.content: The first day of the training dataset.

data_source.validation_method.date_range.title: Training End Date
data_source.validation_method.date_range.content: The last day of the training dataset. Must be before the validation start date.

data_source.validation_method.date_range.title: Validation Start Date
data_source.validation_method.date_range.content: The first day of the validation dataset.

data_source.validation_method.date_range.title: Validation End Date
data_source.validation_method.date_range.content: The last day of the validation dataset.

data_source.validation_method.percentage.title: Validation Percentage
data_source.validation_method.percentage.content: The percentage of the most recent data to reserve for the validation set. The rest will be used for training.

data_source.validation_method.kfold.k_fo.title: Number of Folds (K)
data_source.validation_method.kfold.k_fo.content: The number of sequential train/validation splits to create. A value of 5 means the data will be split into 5 chunks, and the model will be trained 5 times.

input_params.data_processing.resampling_.title: Resampling Factor
input_params.data_processing.resampling_.content: Groups the source data into larger candles. For example, a factor of **60** on 'minute' data will create **1-hour** candles.

input_params.data_processing.input_windo.title: Input Window Size (N)
input_params.data_processing.input_windo.content: The number of candles that constitute a single training sample (e.g., a single image).

input_params.data_processing.prediction_.title: Prediction Horizon (k)
input_params.data_processing.prediction_.content: How many steps (candles) into the future the model should try to predict. The label for a sample at time `t` will be derived from data at `t+k`.

input_params.chart_tensor.chart_type.title: Chart Type
input_params.chart_tensor.chart_type.content: Determines how the raw OHLCV data is transformed into a 2D representation (an image tensor) for the model.

options.Candlestick: Standard financial chart. Good for capturing price action patterns.
options.Heikin-Ashi: A modified candlestick chart that smooths price action and makes trends easier to identify.
options.Dynamic 2D Plane: An advanced, abstract representation that uses basis vectors (Time, Price, Volume) to plot data points in a 2D space. Disables visual styling options.

input_params.chart_tensor.channel_depth.title: Tensor Channel Depth
input_params.chart_tensor.channel_depth.content: The number of color channels in the generated image tensor.

options.RGB (3ch): Three channels for Red, Green, and Blue. Can encode more information.
options.RGB + Delta: Four channels, adding a custom 'delta' channel for extra data.

input_params.style_settings.target_heigh.title: Target Height (px)
input_params.style_settings.target_heigh.content: The height of the generated image tensor in pixels.

input_params.style_settings.target_width.title: Target Width (px)
input_params.style_settings.target_width.content: The width of the generated image tensor in pixels.

input_params.style_settings.bar_width.title: Bar Width (px)
input_params.style_settings.bar_width.content: The width of each candlestick or bar in the image.

input_params.style_settings.border_thick.title: Border Thickness (px)
input_params.style_settings.border_thick.content: The thickness of the border around each candlestick.

input_params.style_settings.line_width.title: Line Width (px)
input_params.style_settings.line_width.content: The width of lines used in line charts or for wicks.

input_params.style_settings.up_color_but.title: Up Color
input_params.style_settings.up_color_but.content: The color of candles that close higher than they open.

input_params.style_settings.down_color_b.title: Down Color
input_params.style_settings.down_color_b.content: The color of candles that close lower than they open.

input_params.style_settings.bg_color_but.title: Background Color
input_params.style_settings.bg_color_but.content: The background color of the generated chart image.

input_params.style_settings.line_color_b.title: Line Color
input_params.style_settings.line_color_b.content: The color used for wicks and other line elements.

input_params.style_settings.scaling_mode.title: Scaling Mode
input_params.style_settings.scaling_mode.content: Determines how price data is scaled to fit the image height.

input_params.style_settings.volume_displ.title: Volume Display
input_params.style_settings.volume_displ.content: How trading volume is represented on the chart.

input_params.style_settings.moving_avera.title: Enable Moving Average
input_params.style_settings.moving_avera.content: Check to overlay a simple moving average on the chart.

input_params.style_settings.moving_avera.title: Moving Average Period
input_params.style_settings.moving_avera.content: The number of candles to include in the moving average calculation.

input_params.dynamic_plane.basis_vector_.title: Time Basis Vector
input_params.dynamic_plane.basis_vector_.content: Use the time step as a horizontal (X-axis) basis vector.

input_params.dynamic_plane.basis_vector_.title: Price Basis Vector
input_params.dynamic_plane.basis_vector_.content: Use price change as a vertical (Y-axis) basis vector.

input_params.dynamic_plane.basis_vector_.title: Volume Basis Vector
input_params.dynamic_plane.basis_vector_.content: Use trading volume to influence the position or color of points.

input_params.dynamic_plane.normalization.title: Normalization Strategy
input_params.dynamic_plane.normalization.content: How the vector data is scaled before being plotted.

input_params.dynamic_plane.rotation_logi.title: Rotation Logic
input_params.dynamic_plane.rotation_logi.content: Determines how the frame of reference is rotated to align with the data.

input_params.dynamic_plane.reference_poi.title: Reference Point Strategy
input_params.dynamic_plane.reference_poi.content: The anchor point for all vector calculations within a sample.

input_params.dynamic_plane.outlier_clip_.title: Outlier Clip Percentile
input_params.dynamic_plane.outlier_clip_.content: Clips extreme data points at this percentile to prevent distorted scaling.

input_params.dynamic_plane.include_drift.title: Include Frame Drift Error
input_params.dynamic_plane.include_drift.content: Adds the rotational drift between frames as an additional input channel for the model.

input_params.disk_space.calculate_button.title: Calculate Total Size
input_params.disk_space.calculate_button.content: Scans the selected data source to provide an estimate of the total number of samples and the required disk space for the generated dataset.

model_arch.backbone.architecture.title: Backbone Architecture
model_arch.backbone.architecture.content: The core vision model used to extract features from the input images.

model_arch.backbone.use_pretrained.title: Use Pre-trained Weights
model_arch.backbone.use_pretrained.content: Initialize the backbone with weights pre-trained on the ImageNet dataset. This is highly recommended for transfer learning.

model_arch.backbone.freeze_backbone.title: Freeze Backbone
model_arch.backbone.freeze_backbone.content: Prevent the weights of the backbone model from being updated during training. This is typical for transfer learning where you only train the final layers.

model_arch.sequence_modeling.aggregator.title: Sequence Modeling Method
model_arch.sequence_modeling.aggregator.content: How the model processes the sequence of N images in a sample.

options.None (Channel Stack): The simplest method. The N images are stacked along the channel dimension, creating a tensor with N*C channels. Relies on the 2D CNN to find temporal patterns.
options.Time-Distributed CNN + LSTM: Applies the vision backbone to each image individually, then feeds the sequence of feature vectors into an LSTM or GRU to model temporal dependencies.
options.Transformer Encoder: A more advanced method where image features are treated as a sequence of tokens and processed by a Transformer, allowing the model to weigh the importance of different time steps.

model_arch.prediction_heads.primary_outp.title: Primary Output
model_arch.prediction_heads.primary_outp.content: The main task the model is being trained to perform.

model_arch.prediction_heads.aux_rally_ti.title: Auxiliary Head: Rally Time
model_arch.prediction_heads.aux_rally_ti.content: Adds a secondary output to the model that predicts how long it will take for the price to reach a certain target magnitude.

model_arch.prediction_heads.aux_directio.title: Auxiliary Head: Directional Confidence
model_arch.prediction_heads.aux_directio.content: Adds a secondary output that predicts the probability that the primary direction prediction is correct.

model_arch.prediction_heads.hidden_units.title: Hidden Units
model_arch.prediction_heads.hidden_units.content: The number of neurons in the hidden layers of the prediction head.

model_arch.prediction_heads.dropout.title: Dropout
model_arch.prediction_heads.dropout.content: The fraction of neurons to randomly drop during training to prevent overfitting.

model_arch.prediction_heads.activation.title: Activation Function
model_arch.prediction_heads.activation.content: The non-linear activation function used in the prediction head layers.

model_arch.hyperparameters.learning_rate.title: Learning Rate
model_arch.hyperparameters.learning_rate.content: Controls how much the model's weights are adjusted during training. Can be a fixed value (e.g., 0.001) or use scientific notation (e.g., 1e-4).

model_arch.hyperparameters.optimizer.title: Optimizer
model_arch.hyperparameters.optimizer.content: The algorithm used to update the model's weights.

model_arch.hyperparameters.loss_function.title: Loss Function
model_arch.hyperparameters.loss_function.content: The function used to measure the error between the model's prediction and the true label.

model_arch.hyperparameters.batch_size.title: Batch Size
model_arch.hyperparameters.batch_size.content: The number of training samples processed before the model's weights are updated.

model_arch.hyperparameters.max_epochs.title: Max Epochs
model_arch.hyperparameters.max_epochs.content: The maximum number of times the model will iterate over the entire training dataset.

model_arch.hyperparameters.early_stoppin.title: Early Stopping Patience
model_arch.hyperparameters.early_stoppin.content: The number of epochs to wait for an improvement in validation loss before stopping the training early. Set to 0 to disable.

model_arch.input_constraints.input_chann.title: Input Channels
model_arch.input_constraints.input_chann.content: A read-only display showing the number of channels required by the selected model backbone.

model_arch.input_constraints.target_reso.title: Target Resolution
model_arch.input_constraints.target_reso.content: A read-only display showing the target image resolution required by the selected model backbone.

pred_target.regression.return_calculatio.title: Return Calculation Method
pred_target.regression.return_calculatio.content: Defines how the percentage return for a regression label is calculated.

pred_target.regression.label_scaling.title: Label Scaling
pred_target.regression.label_scaling.content: How the final return value is scaled before being fed to the model.

pred_target.classification.class_logic.title: Class Logic
pred_target.classification.class_logic.content: Defines the categories for classification tasks.

pred_target.classification.buy_threshold.title: Buy Threshold (%)
pred_target.classification.buy_threshold.content: The minimum positive return required to be classified as a 'Buy' signal.

pred_target.classification.sell_threshol.title: Sell Threshold (%)
pred_target.classification.sell_threshol.content: The maximum negative return required to be classified as a 'Sell' signal. Values between the buy and sell thresholds are 'Hold'.

pred_target.rally_time.target_magnitude.title: Target Magnitude (%)
pred_target.rally_time.target_magnitude.content: The percentage price increase the model should predict the time to.

pred_target.rally_time.max_horizon.title: Max Horizon (candles)
pred_target.rally_time.max_horizon.content: The maximum number of future candles to search for the target magnitude. If not found, the label is capped at this value.

pred_target.frame_of_reference.target_fr.title: Target Frame of Reference
pred_target.frame_of_reference.target_fr.content: Determines if the prediction target is an absolute value or relative to the sample's local context (for Dynamic Plane charts).

error_correction.standard.loss_function.title: Loss Function
error_correction.standard.loss_function.content: The function used to measure the error between the model's prediction and the true label.

error_correction.standard.patience.title: Early Stopping Patience
error_correction.standard.patience.content: The number of epochs to wait for an improvement in validation loss before stopping the training early.

error_correction.dynamic_plane.drift_thr.title: Drift Threshold
error_correction.dynamic_plane.drift_thr.content: The error threshold at which the 'Freeze & Correct' rotation logic will trigger a correction.

error_correction.dynamic_plane.healing_d.title: Healing Decay Rate
error_correction.dynamic_plane.healing_d.content: The rate at which the correction factor decays back to zero once the model's predictions become accurate again.

file_saving.model_save_path_input.title: Model Save Path
file_saving.model_save_path_input.content: The directory where the trained model checkpoints will be saved.

file_saving.model_save_path_browse_butto.title: Browse
file_saving.model_save_path_browse_butto.content: Select a directory for saving models.

file_saving.training_data_path_input.title: Training Data Path
file_saving.training_data_path_input.content: The directory where the generated image tensors for the training set will be saved.

file_saving.training_data_path_browse_bu.title: Browse
file_saving.training_data_path_browse_bu.content: Select a directory for saving training data.

file_saving.augmented_data_path_input.title: Augmented Data Path
file_saving.augmented_data_path_input.content: The directory where any augmented versions of the training data will be saved.

file_saving.augmented_data_path_browse_b.title: Browse
file_saving.augmented_data_path_browse_b.content: Select a directory for saving augmented data.

run_output.experiment_name.title: Experiment Name
run_output.experiment_name.content: The name for this training run. It is automatically generated from a hash of the parameters, but you can override it. This name will be used for saving artifacts.

run_output.revert_button.title: Revert to ID
run_output.revert_button.content: Revert the experiment name to the automatically generated ID.

run_output.output_metrics.loss_curve.title: Output Loss Curve
run_output.output_metrics.loss_curve.content: Generate a plot showing training and validation loss over epochs.

run_output.output_metrics.accuracy_curve.title: Output Accuracy Curve
run_output.output_metrics.accuracy_curve.content: Generate a plot showing prediction accuracy or correctness over epochs.

run_output.output_metrics.sharpe_ratio.title: Calculate Sharpe Ratio
run_output.output_metrics.sharpe_ratio.content: Calculate the Sharpe Ratio from a simulated backtest of the model's predictions.

run_output.output_metrics.alpha_beta.title: Calculate Alpha & Beta
run_output.output_metrics.alpha_beta.content: Calculate Alpha and Beta metrics against a benchmark.

run_output.output_metrics.cumulative_ret.title: Plot Cumulative Return
run_output.output_metrics.cumulative_ret.content: Generate a plot showing the equity curve of a simulated backtest.

run_output.output_metrics.max_drawdown.title: Calculate Max Drawdown
run_output.output_metrics.max_drawdown.content: Calculate the maximum peak-to-trough decline in portfolio value.

run_output.dynamic_plane_diagnostics.vec.title: Log Vector Deviation
run_output.dynamic_plane_diagnostics.vec.content: Output logs detailing the deviation of data points from the established basis vectors.

run_output.dynamic_plane_diagnostics.cor.title: Trace Correction Factor
run_output.dynamic_plane_diagnostics.cor.content: Generate a plot showing how the correction factor changes during training (for 'Freeze & Correct' logic).

run_output.dynamic_plane_diagnostics.inp.title: Save Input Snapshots
run_output.dynamic_plane_diagnostics.inp.content: Save a sample of the generated 2D plane image tensors for manual inspection.

setup_tab.navigation_list.title: Setup Steps
setup_tab.navigation_list.content: Navigate through the different stages of configuring a training experiment. A checkmark indicates a visited step.

setup_tab.apply_button.title: Apply Configuration
setup_tab.apply_button.content: Validate and save the current experiment configuration to `build/last_applied_config.json`. This makes it the active configuration for the 'Monitor' tab.

setup_tab.apply_and_run_button.title: Apply and Run
setup_tab.apply_and_run_button.content: Apply the configuration and immediately switch to the 'Monitor' tab to start the training experiment.
